It is quite interesting that three previous
dies of doped LLZO each reported that only one of the two
(2014b) analysed Ga-doped LLZO at an applied ﬁeld
of 9.4 T with relatively slow sample spinning and observed
line. On the other hand, Bernuy-Lopez
. (2014) investigated LLZO doped with up to 0.30 pfu
Ga at 11.75 T and fast sample spinning; they observed only
been obscured by the lower magnetic ﬁeld and slower spin-
ning rates applied in the ﬁrst two of these studies, there is
little doubt that the narrow peak from the 96
easily have been observed in the study of Bernuy-Lopez
. (2014) if Ga populated this site in the material. The
observation of both sites in the same material presented here
provides the ﬁrst evidence that Ga can populate both the 96
sites in the same doped LLZO. This datumprovides
vital information on the structure and is important for devel-
oping the model of Li-ion dynamics in the system.
3.2.3 Site preferences of Al and Ga in dopant-stabilized

proportional to the amount of the measured nuclei, the site
distribution can be evaluated. The resulting site occupancies
are quite similar and range from 0.2: 0.1 (LLZO:

similar site preference for Al and Ga; the dopant distribu-
tion among the available sites in LLZO may of course
strongly depend on the synthesis conditions chosen. This
might also serve to explain differences in interpretation
4.1 Phase stability and solubility of Fe
In this work we synthesized a series of LLZO:Fe
We were able to synthesize pure cubic LLZO with
pfu and 6.54 Li pfu, whereby the former
is the minimum amount of Fe

4.2 Phase stability and solubility of Al and Ga
So far, efforts were spent to investigate the solubility of
Al and Ga in LLZO and their inﬂuence on phase
